summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. is set to inject $10 billion capital to its overseas unit to shore up forex hedging operations . It’s the third such deal since 2024, and by far the largest by far . TSMC Global Ltd. has approved a plan to increase its capital by issuing new shares to its parent .  Recent strength in the Taiwan dollar has caused worries in Taipei about the economy’s heavy reliance on exports . In May, the currency notched its biggest single-day gain since the 1980s, spurring calls from the central bank to curb speculation .  TSMC, the main chipmaker to Apple Inc. and Nvidia Corp., is by far the island’s biggest company and exporter . A stronger Taiwan dollar hurts exporters because the US dollars they earn from sales abroad would translate into less of the local currency .  Gap can also fund its US asset and expansion plans with less FX conversion risk, says a foreign-exchange strategist at Oversea-Chinese Banking Corp Ltd. “It can also . fund their US asset . and expansion plan with less currency conversion risk," he says .

Apple announces updates to its developer policies to comply with the EU’s Digital Markets Act . EU app developers will now be able to link to alternative ways to pay for subscriptions and other in-app purchases outside the App Store .  Apple has introduced a new fee structure for developers in the App Store . There's now an initial acquisition fee (2%) and a store services fee (5%) Tier 1 developers have access to a more limited set of App Store services . Tier 2 provides marketing tools, automatic updates, curation and personalization features, app insights, and more .  Developers who currently pay the old CTF will move to the new rules by January 1, 2026 . For developers on the standard terms in the EU, the CTC — a 5% commission — will instead apply . Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney, whose company sued Apple and won the right to use alternative payments without a commission in the U.S., calls it more malicious compliance .

J.P. Morgan thinks iPhone 17 sales could be flat later on . They've kept Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) at Overweight, but nudged their price target down from $240 to $230 . They see demand cooling off once tariffs and China subsidies subside .  We see actual sell-through on the iPhone 17, then dive in ahead of the bigger rebound . This article first appeared on GuruFocus.com .

For Apple, artificial intelligence is the key to future-proofing its robust devices and services ecosystem . Yet in China, Apple’s AI ambitions have hit a wall . Alibaba Group has just handed Apple a potential key . Its Qwen3 AI models have been fine-tuned for Apple's MLX framework .  Nearly six months into 2025, Apple bulls are still bruised, with shares 23% off their peak . Alibaba’s open-source route gives it both flexibility and local legitimacy . This could finally pave the road for Apple Intelligence to launch in China - a much-needed boost for iPhone sales .  Apple’s fiscal Q2 2025 arrived on May 1 with both flash and friction . Revenue hit $95.4 billion, climbing 5.1% year over year, while net income rose to $24.8 billion . While tech rebounded in May, Apple missed the rally and dropped 6% that month alone .  Apple closed the quarter with $28.2 billion in cash, dwarfing its $6 billion in short-term liabilities . The company doubled down on shareholder returns, authorizing a massive $100 billion stock buyback and raising its dividend by 4% to $0.26 per share . Analysts monitoring the company remain optimistic, predicting its EPS to be around $7.11 for fiscal 2025 .  Alibaba's move could clear the regulatory fog and let Apple roll out Apple Intelligence in China, where tight data laws demand a domestic partner . But the alliance is drawing fire back home. U.S. lawmakers worry the deal could unwittingly help China advance its AI agenda using Apple's ecosystem .  The Street-high target price of $300 suggests that the stock could rally as much as 50% . The average analyst price target for AAPL is $230.75, indicating potential upside of 14% .

Apple now has more than 1 billion paid subscribers across its Services portfolio . Services revenues grew 11.6% year over year to $26.65 billion . Infusion of Apple Intelligence into Services offerings like Apple Wallet and Apple Music is expected to drive top-line growth .  Apple's Services revenues are expected to see a CAGR of 15.6% between 2024 and 2027 . Apple Pay expands the ability to pay with rewards and installments to in-store purchases for added flexibility and choice .  Apple shares have dropped 19.5% year to date (YTD), underperforming the broader Zacks Computer & Technology sector’s return of 4.5%. Apple stock is trading at a premium, with a forward 12-month Price/Sales of 7.25X . Disney is benefiting from strength in Domestic Parks & Experiences revenues driven by growth at domestic parks, Disney Vacation Club and Disney Cruise Line .  The consensus mark for fiscal 2025 earnings is pegged at $7.11 per share, unchanged over the past 30 days, suggesting 5.33% year-over-year growth . Apple currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) Apple is one of today’s #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks .

The eSIM market size was valued atUS$ 5.51 billionin 2024 and isexpected to reachUS$ 17.98 billionby 2031 . It is estimated to register a CAGR of 18.7% during 2025–2031 . The increasing integration of eSIM technology in smartphones is a key driver propelling the growth .  The increasing integration of eSIM technology in smartphones is a key driver propelling the growth of the global eSIM market . Leading smartphone manufacturers such as Apple, Samsung, and Google continue to embed eSIM functionality in their latest models . This shift marks a departure from traditional SIM cards, offering enhanced flexibility, security and a seamless user experience .  By 2030, an estimated 98% of all smartphone connections inNorth Americawill utilize eSIM technology . Google has played a pioneering role in driving eSIM adoption within the Android ecosystem . The integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into eSIM connectivity solutions is significantly enhancing network performance .  As of 2023, nearly 400 network operators worldwide offer eSIM services, creating a robust foundation for AI-driven capabilities to scale across global markets . AI also plays a pivotal role in strengthening the security of eSIM technology .  On the basis of component, the global eSIM market is segmented into hardware and software & services . In 2024,North Americaled the market with a substantial revenue share, followed by Europe and Asia Pacific . The consumer eSIMs segment dominated the market in 2024 .  Infineon Technologies AG has claimed the industry's smallest GSMA-compliant and first 28-nm eSIM solution with the launch of the OPTIGA Connect Consumer OC1230. It allows up to 50 percent less energy consumption compared to eSIMs on the market, extending the lifetime of the device's battery .  The eSIM (Embedded SIM) market is experiencing rapid growth, driven by increasing adoption across consumer electronics, automotive, and industrial IoT sectors . Unlike traditional SIM cards, eSIMs are embedded directly into devices, enabling remote provisioning and offering greater flexibility for users and mobile network operators . Semiconductor giant Nvidia (NVDA) has solidified its position as the world's most valuable company, achieving a market capitalization of $3.77 trillion . In the month of June alone, NVDA has gained a staggering 15.16% - easily outstripping its average return of 1.31% for the month since 2010 . NVDA stock reached a new record high of $156.71 earlier today .  Nvidia isn’t expected to report quarterly earnings until late August, and the stock has averaged a positive return of 3.03% in July dating back to 2010 . Last year’s 5.28% July selloff was a notable divergence from historical averages .  Nvidia's technological leadership remains unchallenged, with nearly 100 Nvidia-powered AI factories now in progress . The broader AI infrastructure market shows tremendous potential, with data center spending projected to grow from $455 billion in 2024 to $1.1 trillion by 2029 . The company maintains impressive margins above 70%, despite product launches and market challenges .  Nvidia's dominance in AI computing hardware continues to strengthen, with analysts projecting the AI chip market to grow to $2 trillion by 2028 . Trading at 37.7 times forward earnings and 18.8 times forward sales, NVDA stock appears reasonably valued compared to Wall Street’s growth projections . Technical traders will note that NVDA looks short-term overbought, based on a break above its upper Bollinger Band and a 14-day Relative Strength Index reading above 74 .  bulls may soon have an opportunity to pick up Nvidia shares on a pullback to technical support . current levels, and bulls could soon have a chance to buy Nvidia shares . The shares are currently trading around $6,000 per day .

Nvidia (NVDA) stock rose to its record high, surging past the $150 price level yesterday, June 25 . It has been a remarkable turnaround for the chip designing giant . Nvidia is now back to being the world’s most valuable company, a position it has held off and on .  Nvidia stock has hit record highs after a stellar Q1 2026 earnings report . The company beat on both the top line and bottom line and provided upbeat guidance . Nvidia’s mean target price is $174.83, while the most recent Street-high target price (via Loop Capital) is $250 .  Nvidia would need to rise over 29% for the stock to hit $200, sending its market cap to almost $5 trillion . The company is expected to generate revenues of almost $200 billion in the current fiscal year, 53% higher than the previous year . Another 25% rally will help Nvidia’s stock reach its Street-high target price of $250 .  Analysts are modelling Nvidia’s earnings per share to rise 36.7% in the current fiscal year . Nvidia trades at a forward price-earnings (P/E) multiple of almost 37x . If Nvidia were to rise to $200, it would trade at around 50x its expected EPS this year .  NVDA stock currently has momentum, and I don't see any immediate risk to the rally, barring a macroeconomic shock . The next trigger for Nvidia could be a potential easing of China export restrictions, or the company coming up with a new chip that it can export under the current set of rules . Overall, I would not rule out the possibility of Nvidia stock rising above $200, if not this year, then in the coming year .

Apple may be one of the strongest long-term performers inequity markets, but its current valuation is increasingly detached from the company's underlying fundamentals . Rather than being driven by innovation or meaningful expansion, its stock performance has leaned heavily on financial engineering .  Apple has not increased revenues meaningfully since 2022 (EPS is flat as well) Service growth has also stagnated with significant focus on regulatoryheadwinds such as within the EU regarding App store policies and anti-competitive processeses . The company seemingly has done nothing to expand within theartificial intelligence boom and as an extensive user of the Apple ecosystem, the company seems to have been left in the dust .  Apple generated approximately $~400 billion in total revenue in 2013 . Over $200 billion, came from the iPhone alone . Wearables, Home, and Accessories segment contributed around $39.8billion .  Apple's Services segment, often touted as the company's growth driver, brought in $85 billion in FY23, or 22% of total revenue . Mac and iPad revenues now combine for just 15% of the business . Collectively over 75% of Apple's revenue still comes from hardware, much of it consumer discretionary .  Apple has incredibly negative exposure geopolitically and is one of the mostsensitive companies to tariffs on the broader market . US Consumer intent to purchase a new iPhone is at a five yearlow . India, the company's so called golden goose for future growth has failed to grow .  Despite rapidly increasing purchasing power of the Indian consumer, Apple's market share has flatlined around ~20% since 2022 . The company's exposure to policy volatility and lack of meaningful market penetration in keygrowth regions is a serious headwind going forward .

SoundHound is a newer entrant leveraging its conversational voice platform across industries from automotive to restaurants . Cerence is an established leader in in-car voice assistants for automakers . Both companies operate in the voice AI space .  SoundHound has emerged as a leader in voice AI by combining advanced speech recognition with large language models to power natural, voice-based interactions . Its Polaris AI engine delivers fast, accurate responses — even in noisy settings — supporting applications across industries . The company’s acquisitions of SYNQ3, Amelia and Allset have expanded its capabilities in restaurant ordering, customer service and voice commerce .  SoundHound’s first-quarter 2025 results highlight strong momentum . Revenues surged 151% year over year to $29.1 million, driven by organic growth and recent acquisitions . Partnerships with Lucid Motors and NVIDIA extend its footprint into luxury EVs and edge AI . Its enterprise solutions are used by top global banks, reflecting strong B2B adoption .  Full-year revenue guidance of $157-$177 million implies a near doubling . SoundHound is targeting adjusted EBITDA breakeven by year-end . The company is well-capitalized, holding $246 million in cash and no debt .  Cerence stands as the leading voice AI provider in the automotive industry . Technology embedded in more than 500 million vehicles and powering roughly 51% of cars produced in the trailing 12 months ending the fiscal second quarter .  Cerence’s fiscal second-quarter results reflect progress in its turnaround strategy . Revenues rose 15% year over year to $78 million, slightly exceeding guidance . The gross margin improved to 77% on a favorable software mix .  Cerence faces several challenges despite strong fiscal second-quarter performance . The absence of fixed-license revenues in the second half will pressure margins and profitability . Professional services revenues are declining faster than expected due to product standardization . Legal disputes with Samsung and Microsoft add costs and risks . SoundHound stock has risen 7.7% over the past year .  Both SOUN and CRNC stocks have underperformed the Zacks Computer and Technology sector during the period . SoundHound’s stock has been volatile, reflecting the high expectations built into its valuation . Meanwhile, Cerence shares have rallied 10.6% over the same period .  Both SoundHound AI and CRNC are prominent players in voice AI, yet they present starkly different investment profiles . SOUN is a high-growth upstart, doubling its revenues and expanding aggressively across industries . CRNC management has cited sluggish EV sales and softness in China as headwinds in the current year .  Cerence, though more deeply entrenched in the auto market, faces growth constraints and contract headwinds . SoundHound AI, Inc. appears better positioned for long-term growth despite its premium valuation . Cerence’s stock arguably has a more limited immediate upside, with its growth constrained by industry softness .  Zacksacksacks. (Zacks) was last week's top 10 best-ranked stock market for the year . For all the latest news from the world, see www.zacks.com .

Nvidia's stock closed at $154.31 on Wednesday, exceeding its prior closing high of $149.43 on January 6 . CEO Jensen Huang's comments on growth areas for the company boosted investor confidence . US export restrictions to China will impact Nvidia's revenue, the company said .  Nvidia said last month that it expects to lose about $8 billion in second-quarter revenue due to the loss of sales of H20 chips . In April, President Donald Trump's administration issued new rules to stop Nvidia from selling its H20 AI processor to China .  Nvidia reported $17.1 billion in revenue from China for its last fiscal year . Revenue from China increased 66% from the year before . The chipmaker's stock is up almost 15% so far this year .

Mark Zuckerberg has framed the company’s growth trajectory around a provocative premise: liberation from the “random rules” imposed by competitors could unlock transformative financial gains . This statement reflects Zuckerberg's longstanding frustration with platform dependencies, particularly Apple's iOS ecosystem, which he argues restricts Meta's innovation .  Zuckerberg estimates that eliminating these constraints could double Meta’s profitability . The social media giant says it has a user base exceeding 3 billion people . Under his direction, Meta has navigated multiple technological shifts — from desktop to mobile, and now toward AI and mixed reality .  The tension between Meta and Apple extends beyond financials to fundamental values . Zuckerberg champions “open platforms” where third-party developers innovate freely . This contrasts sharply with Apple’s “walled garden” approach .  Zuckerberg’s vision — of Meta building the next generation of open platforms — aims to reshape industry dynamics, ensuring that future computing paradigms prioritize accessibility over gatekeeping . As mixed reality and artificial intelligence (AI) evolve, Meta's success in this endeavor will determine whether it can realize Zuckerberg's projection of doubled profitability, or remain tethered to rivals' rules .  This article was originally published on Barchart.com . All information and data in this article is solely for informational purposes. We are happy to make clear that we do not hold any positions in any of the securities mentioned in the article .

Norwegian software group Visma has chosen London over Amsterdam for its upcoming initial public offering . The IPO, expected early next year, will test whether the UK government's recent efforts to revive London’s capital markets are starting to bear fruit .  The decision to list in London offers a glimmer of hope for the UK's primary markets, which have seen a sharp decline in new IPO activity . In 2023, 88 companies either delisted from the London Stock Exchange’s main market or shifted their primary listing elsewhere, mainly to New York .  British microchip company Arm decided to float in New York rather than London last year . Experts called it a “kick in the teeth” for London . Bolt chief executive Markus Villig cast doubt on the capital’s appeal at London Tech Week .  Failure to back “risk takers’ means London is unable to compete with New York . Visma’s listing could help shift that perception . Bank pitches for the IPO are expected to begin this week .

Apple's brand may be the most valuable on Earth, but that's about all it has going for it . Amazon's and Alphabet's performances aren't the only reason they'll surpass Apple . I think we'll see Amazon and Alphabet surpass Apple by 2030 .  Apple's stock trades like a hot growth stock, trading at 28 times forward earnings . TheS&P 500 trades at 22.8 times forward Earnings, with an average growth rate of about 10% per year . If Apple's valuation were to decline to a market-average multiple, it would tumble nearly 20% . Amazon's market cap is $2.23 trillion and Alphabet's $22.03 trillion .  Amazon can be split into two businesses: commerce and Amazon Web Services, its cloud computing wing . In the first quarter, AWS accounted for 63% of Amazon's operating profits despite making up just 19% of revenue . This makes revenue growth a poor metric for evaluating Amazon's stock . Instead, investors should consider operating income growth .  Amazon's path to surpassing Apple is easier than Amazon's: It needs to be valued at the same level . Over the past 12 months, Alphabet's net income surpassed Apple's . Apple gets a premium valuation, but Alphabet's stock trades at a huge discount to the market . I expect Apple's valuation to trend downward over the next five years .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is809% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to175% for the S&P 500 . Consider when Netflixmade this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation, you'd have $689,813!  The Motley Fool recommends the following options: long January 2026 $395 calls on Microsoft . Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, and Nvidia could be worth more than $1 billion by 2030 .

Teresa Ribera, EU’s competition chief, rejects suggestions that enforcement of the landmark Digital Markets Act could be sacrificed as part of a deal to dodge punitive EU tariffs pitched by the White House . “We do not challenge the United States on how they implement their rules or how they adopt regulations,” she said .  The EU estimates that US duties now cover €380 billion ($446 billion) of its exports to the US . The US President has specifically called out the EU’s tech regulations as a non-tariff trade barrier .  Over recent years the EU has issued costly penalties against firms, including more than $8 billion in fines against Google . Under its abuse-of-dominance rules, it has also forced changes out of Amazon.com and Apple’s marketplace platform .

Retail investors are playing an increasingly important role in the stock market . Artificial intelligence giants Apple and Nvidia were once the most held stocks on Robinhood .  Robinhood's "100 Most Popular" list details which stocks and exchange-traded funds (ETFs) are most commonly held by Robinhood customers . Apple and Nvidia once topped the ranks on Robinhood as respective No. 1 holdings .  Since 2013, Apple has bought back approximately $775 billion worth of its common stock, which works out to more than 43% of its outstanding shares . Apple boasts the largest share-repurchase program on the planet among public companies .  Apple's net income fell from $99.8 billon to $93.7 billion between fiscal 2022 and 2024 . Nvidia has potential red flags, including export restrictions to China . Apple's physical product sales have declined and there's not been much innovation momentum .  The brand-name artificial intelligence stock that's blown past Apple and Nvidia to become the most widely held of all securities on Robinhood is none other than electric-vehicle (EV) makerTesla . Ark Invest's Cathie Wood believes Tesla will reach $2,600 per share by 2029 .  Retail investors seem to appreciate Tesla's push to become more than just an EV company . Over the trailing four quarters (ended March 31, 2025), it's generated close to $11.2 billion in sales from energy generation and storage . This segment should help to minimize the cyclical ebbs and flows that come with being an auto stock .  Tesla has been promising Level 5 autonomy "next year" for 11 straight years, yet his company hasn't moved past Level 2 autonomy . Tesla's vehicle margin has plummeted as competition has picked up .  Tesla stock has become widely detached from its underlying operating performance . President Donald Trump said the US would hold a meeting with Iran next week but cast doubt on the need for a diplomatic agreement . He reiterated that US strikes on the Natanz, Isfahan and Fordow facilities had “obliterated” them, again disputing an early American intelligence assessment . “We may sign an agreement, I don’t think it’s that necessary.”  Comments come on day two of a ceasefire between Israel and Iran . Iran has been sending signals that it’s ready to resume talks, which were underway with the US before Israel attacked . “The logic of war has failed — return to the logic of diplomacy,” Iran's mission to the United Nations says .  Witkoff: "We were hopeful when we first started negotiations. It didn’t quite work out that way, but today, we are hopeful. The signs are there," he says . The US has been “having conversations with the Iranians” and that “multiple interlocutors are reaching out to us,” he adds .  Iran, a diplomatic track makes as much sense today as it did before the attack, says Ray Takeyh, a senior fellow at the Council on Foreign Relations . The UN’s nuclear watchdog has for decades been central to monitoring of Iranian nuclear activities .  IAEA says inspections in Iran should resume ‘as soon as possible’ to determine what’s happened to stocks of uranium enriched to 60% levels, not far short of the 90% required to build a bomb . Iran's parliament has approved legislation that would suspend cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency until nuclear sites are secured .  Iran’s nuclear installations were “badly damaged” by US airstrikes, a foreign ministry spokesman says . The White House declined to specify to whom Trump was referring . Earlier this month, Trump had said Iran was “weeks away” from having an atomic weapon .  At least 28 people have been killed in Iran in missile attacks, emergency services officials say . The death toll from Israeli airstrikes climbs to 627 and more than 4,800 have been wounded . Iran maintains that its nuclear program has purely civilian purposes, and that it's entitled to pursue that goal .  The shekel is the world’s best-performing currency this week, according to data compiled by Bloomberg . Bank of Israel Governor Amir Yaron told Bloomberg that the military campaign cost the government about 1% of gross domestic product .  Iran's civil aviation authority said 13 airports in the country’s eastern regions have reopened for flights . Iran's economy is down about 2.5% against the dollar . Trump said both nations are “tired, exhausted”

If I close the lid, the laptop will "suspend," but not really . Putting it in a bag in that state will make it hot, and the fans will choke . This should be enough for the product to be recalled . PC manufacturers can get away with anything today, and Apple can't; it is held to a higher standard .  The Justice Department’s antitrust lawsuit against Google revealed that Apple(AAPL)was paid $20 billion by Google in 2022 to keep it the default search engine in the Safari browser . Google lost the lawsuit, and the DOJ wants the company to cease multibillion-dollar payments to Apple, among other things .  In fiscal 2022, Apple's services revenue was about $78 billion . Total revenue was $394 billion, so about 5% came from Google . Apple has been under fire lately for its apparent failure to launch some amazing artificial intelligence products .  Media reports suggest Apple wants to buy or partner with Perplexity AI to get its hands on its AI-powered search . Bank of America analyst Wamsi Mohan has an Apple stock price target of $235 and rates the stock a buy, based on a favorable price-to-earnings ratio .  Getting into the search advertising market and fixing Siri, with one acquisition, sounds like killing two birds with one stone, but I have my doubts . I think Apple would be better off buying a real search engine instead, because Google is getting worse every day .
